name: reference
title: Reference
description: A bibliographic reference in which an entity is mentioned.

fields.name: referenceID
fields.title: Reference ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: parentReferenceID
fields.title: Parent Reference ID
fields.description: An identifier for a Reference that includes this Reference.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: referenceType
fields.title: Reference Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a Reference.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `book`; `thesis`; `report`; `field notes`; `standard`; `chapter`; `journal article`; `unpublished manuscript`; `conference paper`; `website`; `blog post`; `section`; `figure`; `table`; `page`; `dataset`; `map`; `audiovisual material`; `software`; `legal document`; `nucleotide sequence library`

fields.name: bibliographicCitation
fields.title: Bibliographic Citation
fields.description: A bibliographic reference for the resource.
fields.comments: From Dublin Core, 'Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.' The intended usage of this term in Darwin Core is to provide the preferred way to cite the resource itself. Note that the intended usage of dcterms:references in Darwin Core, by contrast, is to point to the definitive source representation of the resource, if one is available.
fields.examples: `Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, UC Berkeley. MVZ Mammal Collection (Arctos). Record ID: http://arctos.database.museum/guid/MVZ:Mamm:165861?seid=101356. Source: http://ipt.vertnet.org:8080/ipt/resource.do?r=mvz_mammal.` (Occurrence example); `https://www.gbif.org/species/2439608 Source: GBIF Taxonomic Backbone` (Taxon example); `Rand, K.M., Logerwell, E.A. The first demersal trawl survey of benthic fish and invertebrates in the Beaufort Sea since the late 1970s. Polar Biol 34, 475–488 (2011). https://doi.org/10.1007/s00300-010-0900-2` (Event example)

fields.name: title
fields.title: Title
fields.description: A name given to the resource.
fields.comments: Typically, a Title will be a name by which the resource is formally known.
fields.examples: `The first demersal trawl survey of benthic fish and invertebrates in the Beaufort Sea since the late 1970s`

fields.name: issued
fields.title: Issued
fields.description: Date of formal issuance of the resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: identifier
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: An unambiguous reference to a resource within a given context.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to an identification system. Examples include International Standard Book Number (ISBN), Digital Object Identifier (DOI), and Uniform Resource Name (URN). Persistent identifiers should be provided as HTTP URIs.

fields.name: creator
fields.title: Creator
fields.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.
fields.comments: Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Creator should be used to indicate the entity.

fields.name: creatorID
fields.title: Creator ID
fields.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.
fields.comments: Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Creator should be used to indicate the entity.

fields.name: publisher
fields.title: Publisher
fields.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available.
fields.comments: Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

fields.name: publisherID
fields.title: Publisher ID
fields.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available.
fields.comments: Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

fields.name: pagination
fields.title: Pagination
fields.description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd.

fields.name: isPeerReviewed
fields.title: Is Peer Reviewed
fields.description: An indication of whether a Reference was peer reviewed.

fields.name: referenceRemarks
fields.title: Reference Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a Reference.
